intro: Platea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine platea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
